text:
Hey all!

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/creating-a-related-post-listing#display-posts-using-a-js-callback-to-control-html-output|The related post listing module> has started throwing an error.
It seems to be related to the callback method
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/creating-a-related-post-listing>

Any ideas?

In any browser. It was working yesterday. It does not work anywhere for me.
<https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Errors/Missing_initializer_in_const>
i imagine it’s due to the dash

yeah but that snippet is generated by the module itself.
```{% related_blog_posts limit=5, callback="blog_post_formatter" %}```

yes, you’ll need to use the regex option, then…
`split|banner`
I am working on a fix, sorry about this

Hi guys, I'm new here. But had a question and hoping this is the best place to ask. I'd like to create (or use if it already exists)  a module that allows continuous image uploading within a defined space.

Basically, we have a partners page and are creating custom icons that are the logos for each partner to keep the design consistent. Something like my attached image for reference.

I want to use or create a module that will allow me to upload these icons/images into the same area while keeping the layout consistent. So when new partners are added, the team can just use the module to upload the new icon and have it appear in place after the last icon without having to worry about styling or anything else.

Any ideas how I can achieve this?
